---
title: Resources Related to the mosaic Package
---
- Stats: Data and Models in R (Horton) describes how to undertake analyses in De Veaux, Velleman, and Bock's *Stats: Data and Models* (4th edition).  These materials can be found [here](http://nhorton.people.amherst.edu/sdm4).
- Introduction to the Practice of Statistics in R (NJ Horton and BS Baumer) describes how to undertake analyses in R that are introduced as examples in the first chapters of *Introduction to the Practice of Statistics* (6th edition), the excellent text by David Moore, George McCabe, and Bruce Craig. IPS in R can be found <a href="http://nhorton.people.amherst.edu/ips6e">here</a>.
- The Statistical Sleuth in R (NJ Horton) describes how to undertake analyses in R for the examples in the first 13 chapters of the Third Edition of the *Statistical Sleuth: A Course in Methods of Data Analysis* (2013), by Fred Ramsey and Dan Schafer. The materials can be found <a href="http://nhorton.people.amherst.edu/sleuth/">here</a>.
- A paper describing the mosaic package *Less Volume, More Creativity* appraoch can be found [here](https://journal.r-project.org/archive/2017/RJ-2017-024).
- Additional mosaic-related resources and documentation listed [here](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/mosaic/vignettes/mosaic-resources.html).
- Additional mosaic package vignettes listed [here](http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/mosaic).
